alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHERN DEARBORN AND NORTHERN BOONE COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dillsboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Hidden Valley, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Wilmington, French, Hartford, Mount Sinai, Belleview, Idlewild, Cold Springs, Waterloo, Farmers Retreat and Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
